text: The Pan-African Mathematics Olympiads (P.A.M.O.) are the African version of the IMO, International Mathematical Olympiad. ==Description== This event organized each year by the African Mathematics Union (AMU) is a competition among the best pupils in Mathematics of the Secondary Education who are less than twenty (20) years old. ==History== The first PAMO was organized in 1987. ==Format== The competition is made of two rounds. Each round is made of 3 problems for four hours and thirty minutes while each problem's total score is 7 points. There are up to six candidates per country. ==References== == External links == * *http://www.mth.uct.ac.za/outreach/imo/pamo.html Category:Mathematics competitions Category:Recurring events established in 1987
